item.title: Fencing and Matress dumped by bin, 15th June
item.description:
There has been a bunch of old fencing and a mattress dumped by our communal bin outside our flat which has been there now for a few weeks. It’s causing a bit of bother as it’s now encouraging more people to dump large items in our dumpster.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Bike, 15th June
item.description:
This bike has been abandoned in the area for months and is regularly knocked over by people loitering in the area, clearly using and selling drugs. This laneway is a problem and we have asked the management company responsible to lock the gate after business hours and weekends but they are not doing so consistently or effectively. Cars were also there abandoned for months and recently towed away. Individuals were also clearly living in their vehicles on this road. The motorbike remains abandoned and is in bad shape due to these individuals constantly kicking it over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Lyndhurst Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous Flytipping, 15th June
item.description:
There is continuous dumping/flytipping at this site. The main issue is due to those responsible for the gate leading onto a road into the industrial estate, not ensuring it is locked at night. As a result people are free to use the roadway 24 hours. They dump household waste, electricals etc regularly. They also dump it behind a steel fence which I’ve been told is managed by national rail. It attracts vermin and foxes. There were also abandoned vehicles for months which were eventually towed but a motorbike remains. People are clearly dealing and using drugs in this area also as well as dumping their litter and human excrement. I have asked the property owner to lock the gates or barricade them after business hours as it might reduce fly tipping. We need the area cleaned again and pro active movements to discourage flytipping which happens weekly. Raise the height of the fences, close the gaps, and block off corners near pillars where people dump their bags and bags of household rubbish and clothes weekly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Lyndhurst Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
